sentence.Network_en: Miss Hoare called out names and marked them off.
sentence.Network_cn: 霍尔小姐点名后把它们一一划掉。

sentence.Network_en: You've given a whole list of names and addresses at the back.
sentence.Network_cn: 你已经在末尾完整地列出了名字和地址。

sentence.Network_en: Nobody was prepared to risk prosecution by actually naming names.
sentence.Network_cn: 没有人愿意冒着被起诉的风险去真正指认别人。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 花在字典里的解释有哪些？_百度知道 ... 花子[ beggar] 花名[ (register of) names] 花账[ padded accounts (bills)].
The recipients of prizes had their names printed in the paper ., 获奖者名单登在报上.

I hold up a piece of paper . " Ah , but this does . it's a letter written and mailed by your husband only hours before his death . it names names " "我举起一张纸。“啊，但是这个可以证明。这是你丈夫写的一封信，在他死前几个小时寄出。里面提到了人的名字。”
stick down your names on the list ., 把你们的名字写在名单上.

list.abs: 飞享印尼航空，体验非常印度尼西亚 - 蚂蜂窝 ... 航班号 FLIGHT GA 0051 姓名 NAME 始发站 ORIGIN.

Shoes | China Exporters List (中国出口商名录) ... Category( 类别): Company Name( 公司名称): Address( 地址).
不锈钢钝化_百度百科 ... 气味 Smell 产品名称（product name） Product Name 不锈钢钝化液 SL-366.

entry.def: The name of a person, place, or thing is the word or group of words that is used to identify them.

example.ex: 'What's his name?'—'Peter.'...
example.tran: “他叫什么？”——“彼得。”

example.ex: I don't even know if Sullivan's his real name...
example.tran: 我甚至不知道沙利文是否是他的真名。

entry.def: When you name someone or something, you give them a name, usually at the beginning of their life.

example.ex: My mother insisted on naming me Horace.
example.tran: 我母亲坚持给我取名叫霍勒斯。

example.ex: ...a man named John T. Benson...
example.tran: 名叫约翰·T.本森的男人

entry.def: If you name someone or something after another person or thing, you give them the same name as that person or thing.

example.ex: Why have you not named any of your sons after yourself?
example.tran: 为什么没让哪个儿子用你的名字呢？

entry.tran: 叫出…的名称;说出…的名字
entry.def: If you name someone, you identify them by stating their name.

example.ex: It's nearly thirty years since a journalist was jailed for refusing to name a source...
example.tran: 一名记者因拒绝说出消息来源而入狱已经是近30年前的事了。

example.ex: One of the victims of the weekend's snowstorm has been named as twenty-year-old John Barr.
example.tran: 周末暴风雪中的一名罹难者已确认是20岁的约翰·巴尔。

entry.tran: 提出，说出，指出(价格、时间、地点等)
entry.def: If you name something such as a price, time, or place, you say what you want it to be.

example.ex: Call Marty, tell him to name his price.
example.tran: 给马蒂打电话，让他出个价儿。

entry.def: If you name the person for a particular job, you say who you want to have the job.

example.ex: The England manager will be naming a new captain, to replace the injured David Beckham...
example.tran: 英格兰队主教练将任命新队长，接替受伤的大卫·贝克汉姆。

example.ex: When the chairman of Campbell's retired, McGovern was named as his successor...
example.tran: 坎贝尔公司的总裁退休后，麦戈文被选定为继任者。

entry.def: You can refer to the reputation of a person or thing as their name .

example.ex: He had a name for good judgement...
example.tran: 他以判断准确而闻名。

example.ex: She's never had any drug problems or done anything to give jazz a bad name.
example.tran: 她从没有吸过毒，也没做过任何有损爵士乐名声的事。

entry.def: You can refer to someone as, for example, a famous name or a great name when they are well-known.

example.ex: ...some of the most famous names in modelling and show business.
example.tran: 模特和时装界一些最知名的红人

example.ex: ...top names such as Nike, Levi's, Calvin Klein and Tommy Hilfiger.
example.tran: 耐克、李维斯、CK和汤米·希尔费格之类的顶级名牌

entry.def: If something is in someone's name, it officially belongs to them or is reserved for them.

example.ex: The house is in my husband's name...
example.tran: 房子是我丈夫名下的。

example.ex: A double room had been reserved for him in the name of Muller.
example.tran: 已用穆勒的名字为他预订了一个双人间。

entry.def: If someone does something in the name of a group of people, they do it as the representative of that group.

example.ex: In the United States the majority governs in the name of the people...
example.tran: 在美国，多数派代表民众执政。

example.ex: She accepted the gift in the name of the Save the Children Fund.
example.tran: 她代表“拯救儿童基金会”接受了礼物。

entry.def: If you do something in the name of an ideal or an abstract thing, you do it in order to preserve or promote that thing.

example.ex: ...one of those rare occasions in history when a political leader risked his own power in the name of the greater public good...
example.tran: 历史上少有的例子之一，政治领袖为更大的公共利益，甘冒丢官弃职的风险

example.ex: There had been times when she had felt sickened by the things people did in the name of business.
example.tran: 有时人们打着做生意的幌子所做的事情让她感到恶心。

entry.tran: (加强提问或要求的语气)看在(上帝、人道等)的份儿上
entry.def: People sometimes use expressions such as 'in the name of heaven' or 'in the name of humanity' to add emphasis to a question or request.

example.ex: What in the name of heaven's going on?...
example.tran: 看在上帝份儿上，这到底是怎么回事？

example.ex: In the name of humanity I ask the government to reappraise this important issue.
example.tran: 我以人道的名义请求政府重新评估这一重大问题。

entry.tran: 有实无名的;未被认可的
entry.def: If you say that a situation exists in all but name, you mean that it is not officially recognized even though it exists.

example.ex: ...the group, which is now a political party in all but name...
example.tran: 这一团体，现在是有实无名的政党

example.ex: It's the end of the doctrine in all but name.
example.tran: 这实际上已是该学说的终结，只是未被道明罢了。

entry.def: When you mention someone or something by name, or address someone by name, you use their name.

example.ex: He greets customers by name and enquires about their health.
example.tran: 他跟顾客打招呼时直呼其名，并问他们身体可好。

entry.def: You can use by name or by the name of when you are saying what someone is called.

example.ex: ...a young Australian, Harry Busteed by name...
example.tran: 名叫哈里·巴斯蒂德的澳大利亚年轻人

example.ex: This guy, Jack Smith, does he go by the name of Jackal?
example.tran: 这个叫杰克·史密斯的家伙是不是还有个名字叫杰凯尔？

entry.def: If someone calls you names, they insult you by saying unpleasant things to you or about you.

example.ex: At my last school they called me names because I was so slow...
example.tran: 在之前的学校，因为我反应慢，他们骂过我。

example.ex: They had called her rude names.
example.tran: 他们用粗鲁的言语谩骂她。

entry.def: If you say that something is the name of the game, you mean that it is the most important aspect of a situation.

example.ex: Family values are suddenly the name of the game...
example.tran: 家庭价值观突然变得重要起来。

example.ex: The name of the game is survival.
example.tran: 重要的是活下去。

entry.def: If you lend your name to something such as a cause or project, you support it.

example.ex: He had political points of view and lent his name to a lot of causes.
example.tran: 他很有政治见解，对很多事业都予以支持。

entry.def: If you make a name for yourself or make your name as something, you become well-known for that thing.

example.ex: She was beginning to make a name for herself as a portrait photographer...
example.tran: 她开始成为一个小有名气的人像摄影师。

example.ex: He made his name with several collections of short stories.
example.tran: 他是以几部短篇小说集成名的。

entry.tran: 点出(或指出)(做错事者)的名字
entry.def: If you name names, you identify the people who have done something, often something wrong.

example.ex: Nobody was prepared to risk prosecution by actually naming names.
example.tran: 没有人愿意冒着被起诉的风险去真正指认别人。

entry.tran: (指报纸或官方机构)曝光，点名，指名(业绩差或犯错的人)
entry.def: If something such as a newspaper or an official body names and shames people who have performed badly or who have done something wrong, it identifies those people by name.

example.ex: The government will also name and shame the worst performing airlines.
example.tran: 政府还将曝光业绩最差的航空公司。

entry.def: If you say that a situation exists in name only, you mean that it does not have the status or position that it claims to have.

example.ex: Many of the groups exist in name only...
example.tran: 许多团体实际上是有名无实。

example.ex: He is commander-in-chief in name only.
example.tran: 他只是名义上的总司令。

entry.tran: 凡是你说得出的，凡是你能想到的(应有尽有)
entry.def: You say you name it, usually after or before a list, to indicate that you are talking about a very wide range of things.

example.ex: Pickled cucumbers, jam, pickled berries, tomatoes; you name it, they've got it...
example.tran: 酸黄瓜、果酱、腌浆果、西红柿，凡是你说得出的，他们都有。

example.ex: I also enjoy windsurfing, tennis, racquetball, swimming, you name it.
example.tran: 我也喜欢帆板、网球、短柄墙球、游泳等等，不一而足。

means.word_mean: 1. verbal abuse; a crude substitute for argument

auth_sentence.content: The Romans had their own names for similar instruments.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Romans had their own names for similar instruments.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Romans had their own names for similar instruments.

auth_sentence.content: House names aren't what they used to be.
auth_sentence.res_content: House names aren't what they used to be.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: House names aren't what they used to be.

auth_sentence.content: We are not releasing their names at this time.
auth_sentence.res_content: We are not releasing their names at this time.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We are not releasing their names at this time.

Sentence.sentence: They will include plenty of names no one has yet heard of.
I could also give you the names and numbers of several of my teachers.
We have all seen how a computer's use of personal names often fascinates people and needs them to treat the machine as if it were almost human.
We have all seen how a computer's use of personal names often facinates people and needs them to treat the machine as if it were almost human
